name: Reuben Nachos for Two
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Nachos and Reuben sandwiches are two of my favorite things so I came up with this to use up the leftover corned beef. This can easily be doubled and would be great to serve at a Super Bowl party.
ingredients: ½ cup leftover cubed corned beef
directions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add corned beef and cook until crisp on all sides, about 5 minutes
Place drained sauerkraut in a bowl with caraway seed; stir to combine
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler to high
Place 1/2 of the chips in an oven-proof skillet
Scatter 1/2 of the corned beef and 1/2 of the sauerkraut on top of the chips
Drizzle 1/2 of the Thousand Island dressing over the corned beef and top with 1/2 of the Swiss cheese
Broil in the preheated oven until cheese has melted, about 5 minutes
